slides.title: Into the Laplace Domain
slides.text: Apply a forward Laplace transform to both sides of the differential equation to get an algebraic Laplace-Domain equation.

slides.title: Solve for Y
slides.text: Isolate Y in the Laplace-Domain Equation.

slides.title: Prepare Y for an Inverse
slides.text: Prepare Y(s) for an inverse transform by writing it as a sum of terms that match entries in the transform table.

slides.title: Exit the Laplace Domain
slides.text: Apply the inverse Laplace transform to both sides of the prepared Y, converting Y(s) âžœ y(t) and recovering the solution.

slides.title: Complete Roadmap
slides.text: These are the general steps involved in the Laplace transform method.
